result.execSummary:
The defendant Kathleen E. Edwards was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
If Probation or Extended Supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
*12 days sentence credit if revoked from probation.
*Cases 15CF666, 15CF667, and un-charged DA case 15-4499 dismissed and read-in.
Concurrent with: 15CF557, 15CF683, and 15CF1001

miscConds.notes:
No use or possession of alcohol or entry into bars, taverns, or places that primarily serve alcohol.
No contact with J.E. without his and agent's approval.

Continue with/complete current therapy.
Comply with any conditions/programming per agent.
Provide DNA sample and pay fee.
Undergo AODA assessment and follow-through with recommendations. (only 1 assessment to satisfy both OWI and probation requirement)
PAYABLE DIRECTLY TO AND COLLECTED BY EAU CLAIRE COUNTY CLERK OF COURT.  NOT A CONDITION OF PROBATION.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant appears in custody with Attorney Richard White.
State by Benjamin Webster, ADA.
Preliminary hearing waived in 15CF1001- waiver accepted by Court.
Defendant advised of Constitutional rights/Guilty Plea form.
Agreement reached.

IT IS ORDERED that the signature bond is modified so that the requirement for CTC testing shall not be in place for the time period of November 24, 2015 - November 29, 2015.
/s/ November 20, 2015

Conditions:
No acts or threats of violence against J.E.
Defendant not to consume/possess any alcohol or go into any taverns, bars, establishment/place where alcohol primarily is served/sold.
Defendant is not to be in a vehicle transporting alcohol or have alcohol in residence.
Report to CTC within 24 hours for random/daily testing and/or programming.
Defendant shall not drive without a valid driver's license and only if absolutely sober.
AMENDED: 11/20/15: CTC testing not required for time period of 11/24/15-11/29/15.
